name: appear
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: appear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to start to be seen or to be present

example.eg: He suddenly appeared in the doorway.
example.egtrans: 他突然出现在门口。

example.eg: We'd been in the house a month when dark stains started appearing on the wall.
example.egtrans: 墙上开始出现一些深色的斑迹时，我们在这幢房子里已经住了一个月。

example.eg: His name appears in the film credits for lighting.
example.egtrans: 他作为灯光师出现在电影演职人员名单中。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you appear in court, you are there officially because you are involved in a trial.

example.eg: Both women will be appearing before magistrates later this week.
example.egtrans: 本周晚些时候这两名妇女都将在地方法院出庭。

dsense.name: appear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

example.eg: You've got to appear (to be) calm in an interview even if you're terrified underneath.
example.egtrans: 在面试时，即使内心很怕，也要显出很镇定的样子。

example.eg: To people who don't know him he probably appears (to be) rather unfriendly.
example.egtrans: 在不了解他的人看来，他可能很不友好。

example.eg: Things aren't always what they appear to be.
example.egtrans: 事情并不总像表面看上去的那样。

example.eg: She appears to actually like the man, which I find incredible.
example.egtrans: 她好像真的很喜欢那个男的，这让我觉得难以置信。

example.eg: There appears to be some mistake.
example.egtrans: 好像出了什么错误。

example.eg: It appears (that) she left the party alone.
example.egtrans: 好像她独自离开了聚会。

example.eg: It appears to me (that) (= I think that) we need to make some changes.
example.egtrans: 在我看来，我们要作些变动。

example.eg: It would appear (that) (= it seems that) nobody on board the aircraft actually had a licence to fly it.
example.egtrans: 事实上好像飞机上的所有人都没有飞行执照。

example.eg: It appears as if/as though I was wrong.
example.egtrans: 好像我错了似的。

example.eg: Everything was not as it appeared - secret deals had been done.
example.egtrans: 一切并非看上去的那样——实际上有暗箱交易。

example.eg: I know how it must appear, but it's not really as bad as it looks.
example.egtrans: 我知道看起来会是个什么样子，但实际上也并不像看上去的那么糟糕。

example.eg: "Has he left?" "It appears not/so."
example.egtrans: “他走了吗？”“好像没有／是的。”

example.eg: "I think we're late." "So it appears."
example.egtrans: “我想我们迟到了。”“看来是的。”

dsense.name: appear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to perform publicly in a play, film, or show

example.eg: She will be appearing in the latest adaptation of "Bleak House".
example.egtrans: 她将在《荒凉山庄》最新的改编版本中出演角色。

example.eg: She appears briefly in the new Bond film.
example.egtrans: 她在新的007电影中有几个镜头。

dsense.name: appear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to start to exist or become available

example.eg: I've noticed that smaller cars are starting to appear (= be produced or sold) again.
example.egtrans: 我注意到小型轿车又开始出现了。

example.eg: The film, currently showing in the States, will be appearing on our screens (= we will be able to see it) later this year.
example.egtrans: 这部正在美国上映的电影今年晚些时候将在我国播映。

dsense.name: appear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

example.eg: If she hasn't appeared by ten o'clock I'm going without her.
example.egtrans: 她要是10点钟还到不了，我就自己去了。
